result.execSummary:
The defendant Teresa Lynn Charest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Teresa Lynn Charest is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Teresa Lynn Charest was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  *Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the agent.  *Costs to be collected by the Clerk of Courts Office.

Amended Assessment Report

Defendant Teresa Lynn Charest in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM153 & 15CM183 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 2 in 15CM153 and Ct. 1 in 15CM183.  Count 1 in 15CM153 and Ct. 2 in 15CM183 to be dismissed.  Atty Gumz agrees.
Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.    Court relies on the criminal complaint in both cases for a factual basis.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2 in 15CM153 and Ct. 1 in 15CM183.  Count 1 in 15CM153 and Ct. 2 in 15CM183 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  15CM153:  Ct. 2:  Court orders 5 days in the Marquette County Jail 
Credit = 5 days
Time Served
Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Count 1 to be dismissed.

  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on September 1, 2016

15CM183:  Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
Count 2 to be dismissed.

Defendant Teresa Lynn Charest in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states  he was recently appointed and requests new return date on the matters.  No objection by Atty Hendee.
BY THE COURT:  Reset  Return date scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Authorization to Appear
Return date at 12-02-2015 02:30 pm

with conditions:
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
*Required to submit to random breath tests at the request of Law Enforcement

Defendant Teresa Lynn Charest in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Teresa Lynn Charest in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz files an authorization with the court for this case and 15CM153.
 Atty Gumz states that he does not have a criminal complaint at this time and asks for an adjourned initial appearance for both cases.
Court states that an initial appearance has been set on the other case.  Defendant agrees.

  Atty Gumz reads the criminal complaint on the computer & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.  Court finds probable cause.
BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return to track with 15CM153.

Atty Hendee states that normally he would be asking for a cash bond; however, with Atty Gumz being on the case, the State does not object to a signature bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz responds and asks that the no contact not be ordered but has no objection to the absolute sobriety.  The defendant has contact the Marquette County Chemical Dependency office already for an assessment.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
*Required to submit to random breath tests at the request of Law Enforcement  Return date scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
